summary.para: Provides data for calls to when the feature specified is .
An integer indicating which physical adapter of the device the operation applies to, in a multi-adapter operation.
A structure defining the width, height, and format of the input sample.
A member of the enumeration specifying the interlaced field type of the input sample.
A member of the enumeration specifying the stereo format of the input sample.
A structure specifying the output DXGI format and color space.
A member of the enumeration specifying the stereo format of the output.
A member of the indicating whether the requested format and colorspace conversion is supported. This value is populated by the call to ID3D12Device.CheckFeatureSupport.
A structure specifying the supported scaling capabilities. This value is populated by the call to ID3D12Device.CheckFeatureSupport.
A bitwise OR combination of values from the enumeration specifying the supported video processing features. This value is populated by the call to ID3D12Device.CheckFeatureSupport.
A member of the enumeration specifying the supported deinterlacing capabilities. This value is populated by the call to ID3D12Device.CheckFeatureSupport.
A member of the specifying the supported automatic processing capabilities. This value is populated by the call to ID3D12Device.CheckFeatureSupport.
A bitwise OR combination of values from the enumeration specifying the supported video filtering features. This value is populated by the call to ID3D12Device.CheckFeatureSupport.

An array of structures representing the filter range values. This value is populated by the call to ID3D12Device.CheckFeatureSupport. The calling application must allocate the memory for the filter range list before calling CheckFeatureSupport.
